main event: A meteorological expert observed an oval object traveling from North to South on 3 November 1957.
interesting points: The observation lasted between 2000Z to 2030Z local time., The object was identified as one, but was classified as insufficient information for evaluation., There were no specific details about the object's size, color, or elevation provided., The expert noted he saw the object twice but could not provide additional information., The report concluded the object might be a balloon or aircraft, but this remains uncertain.
witness description: Mr. [Redacted], a meteorological testing branch expert
